intro: Helianthemum sphaerocalyx, commonly known as the globeflower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cistaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its foliage consists of small, rounded leaves that are densely packed, giving it a bushy appearance. The flowers bloom in early summer and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
